content.description: Sit start low in the dihedral overhang matched on an undercling. Climb up and left on pinches and underclings with toehooks to slopers until you can reach the arête. Pull the crux move and bump up to the jug on the arête to pull onto the slab. Continue up the slab to topout.
content.protection: Maybe two pads. The easier slab section is tall.
content.location: On the left most part of the Pig Iron boulder.

content.description: Sit start low on the left end of the boulder on a right hand crimp sidepull and a left hand edge. Throw for the lip and mantle to topout.
content.location: This is the first line on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the right arête under a small roof. Climb up jugs on the arête then topout.
content.location: This line goes up the arete on the right side of the Iron Pig boulder.

content.description: Sit start low directly behind the tree (just left of the start of Iron Pig). Climb up on edges and a pinch before making a big move to jugs. Mantle or wiggle through a reachy topout.
content.location: This is the second line on the right side of the boulder.

content.description: Sit start with your left hand on a jug behind the tree and a right hand undercling. Step up on the large ledge and move right through underclings. Use edges to continue through the bulge to a right handed pocket. Topout out at the highest point on the boulder.
content.location: This is the last line before the arete on the right side of the Pig Iron boulder.

content.description: Sit start low in the dihedral matched on a large triangular hold. Move up and then right through unique holds and an undercling. Use large but awkward holds to pull over the lip and onto the slab. Delicately continue up the smooth slab to a tall topout.
content.protection: 2 pads probably, the slab is tall.
content.location: On the left most part of the Pig Iron boulder.

content.description: Stand start on the low angle slab and continue straight up to the highest point. You can bail to the arête right before the crux if you get scared. The crux is the last two moves. This one is tall.
content.location: This is the obvious tall slab line visible from the trail. Make sure you are comfortable high up on slab if you try this one, which you should!
